pageContext.claim: “[Putin and I] get questions on the witch hunt. And I don't think the people out in the country buy it. But the reporters like to give it a shot. I thought that President Putin was very, very strong.”
pageContext.analysis: A July 2018 Washington Post poll found Democrats and Republicans sharply disagree on whether or not possible collusion between the Trump campaign and Russia is a "serious issue," but overall voters are split 48/48. When the Post's pollsters asked if the investigation should continue in May, 54 percent said it should. In other words, people are "buy it" to various degrees or at least think the investigation should continue.
